sense.name: twice the quantity or amount of something
sense.examples: John paid double what Tom did for tickets to the game. When the dough is double in size, punch it down. The effort to put in a patio was double what we expected. Pete ordered a double scotch on the rocks. Mary scored double with that Scrabble word. (twice the points)

sense.name: any artifact whose utility is intended for two people
sense.examples: The beds in our hotel room were doubles, not queens. How much is a double with a private bath? Mary bought a double hammock from Indians in the Yucatan.

sense.name: professional stand_in for a film actor
sense.examples: The stuntman has played the double of a famous actor is several action films. THere has been speculation that the man who gave the speech was actually a double of the ailing dictator.

sense.name: a person who looks extremely similar to another person
sense.examples: Identical twins are each other's doubles. That girl walking down the street could be the double of Paris Hilton.

sense.name: two_base hit in baseball
sense.examples: The batter hit a long drive to right field for a double. The pitcher allowed a double and two singles in the last inning.

sense.name: raising the stakes or bet of a game by a factor of 2
sense.examples: Bob folded his poker hand after John's double of the bet. Mary's double during the hand of bridge surprised her opponents.

sense.name: sports games where each team is two people
sense.commentary: DOUBLES[+game][+sports][+team][+with_two_people] Note: always in the plural form
sense.examples: Who is playing doubles in the tennis court this afternoon? John enjoys doubles volleyball.

sense.name: walking or moving very fast
sense.examples: The soldiers ran across the open field on the double. The boss says get down to his office on the double!

sense.name: a gamble to decide whether a debt should be cancelled or doubled
sense.examples: Bob lost a lot of money by playing double or nothing on the roulette wheel.
